page.title: 17Housing - South Wendron
page.content: We have no large areas of settlement in our area - the largest is the hamlet of Seworgan, which is not even big enough to show up in our Land Cover Survey. This hamlet is a mixture of quite old farms with newer houses and bungalows built between them. Planners call this "Infilling". There is also a thriving Methodist Chapel. In the rest of the area the housing consists mainly of isolated farms and farm cottages, with a few newer buildings dotted here and there. Several of the older cottages, which were used by farm labourers or miners years ago, have been bought privately and modernised. Some smallholdings have had their buildings sold and their fields let to neighbouring larger farms.
